text:
Viola Harris (July 5, 1926 – August 23, 2017) was an American actress. She was born in Baltimore, Maryland. She was known for roles in television, theater and movies from the 1950s to the 2010s.
Harris has appeared in a number of movies including "The Other Guys", "Choke", "Deconstructing Harry" directed by Woody Allen and "Sex and the City 2".
In 2010, Harris starred in the short movie, "The Secret Friend", directed by Flavio Alves. Harris received positive reviews for her role in the movie.
Harris was married to actor Robert H. Harris until his death in 1981.
Harris died on August 23, 2017 at her home in New York City at age 91.
